laboratory_examinations.findings: Lowest of 2.1 mEq/L was reported, and later serum potassium was 2.6 mEq/L despite oral supplementation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased potassium levels (from 2.1 mEq/L to 2.6 mEq/L) despite treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal serum aldosterone levels at 12 ng/dL.
Markedly increased aldosterone levels on the left, confirming diagnosis of aldosterone-producing adenoma.
Serum potassium was 2.8 mEq/L despite supplementation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant change noted before surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum aldosterone was 79 ng/dL, more than twice the normal level.
